DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Patient Tobacco Use Questionnaire 9 Longest Time Stayed off Cigarettes Since First Told You Had Cancer 7 Point Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of the longest amount of time they have stayed off cigarettes since they were first told they had cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cancer Patient Tobacco Use Questionnaire Longest Time Stayed off Cigarettes Since Cancer Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire developed for the baseline and longitudinal assessment of tobacco use in the cancer setting. Domains include cigarette smoking history and current use, use relative to cancer diagnosis and treatment, other tobacco product use, cessation, and second-hand exposure._A question about the longest time an individual has stayed off cigarettes since they were first told they had cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire developed for the baseline and longitudinal assessment of tobacco use in the cancer setting. Domains include cigarette smoking history and current use, use relative to cancer diagnosis and treatment, other tobacco product use, cessation, and second-hand exposure.

Concepts.definition: A questionnaire developed for the baseline and longitudinal assessment of tobacco use in the cancer setting. Domains include cigarette smoking history and current use, use relative to cancer diagnosis and treatment, other tobacco product use, cessation, and second-hand exposure.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: Since you were first told you
ReferenceDocuments.description: Since you were first told you had cancer, what was the longest time you stayed (or have stayed) off cigarettes?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value sets in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these CDEs.
